unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Time to Brush Up Your Knowledge, Yaar!
normalised: Rental Agreements: Time to Brush Up Your Knowledge, Friend!

unnormalised: Mumbai: Renting in the city of dreams, Mumbai, can feel like navigating a Bollywood plot twist! But before you sign that rental agreement and hand over the token amount, remember, knowledge is power!
normalised: Mumbai: Renting in the city of dreams, Mumbai, can feel like navigating a Bollywood plot twist! But before you sign that rental agreement and hand over the token amount, remember, knowledge is power!

unnormalised: Experts are saying now's the time to REALLY read the fine print. Landlords are becoming savvier, and you don't want any 'Deewar'-level confrontations later, right?
normalised: Experts are saying now is the time to really read the fine print. Landlords are becoming savvier, and you do not want any 'Deewar'-level confrontations later, right?

unnormalised: Recent reports show disputes over security deposits (expect to shell out a few months' rent equivalent) are on the rise. Understand clauses about maintenance - whose responsibility is that leaky tap?
normalised: Recent reports show disputes over security deposits (expect to shell out a few months' rent equivalent) are on the rise. Understand clauses about maintenance - whose responsibility is that leaky tap?

unnormalised: Things like late payment charges (Rs. 500 per day?), lock-in periods (usually 11 months) and the dreaded "visiting hours" need scrutiny.
normalised: Things like late payment charges (rupees five hundred per day?), lock-in periods (usually eleven months) and the dreaded "visiting hours" need scrutiny.

unnormalised: Pro-tip: Get it registered! It avoids legal hassles and is usually a small fee (around Rs. 1100 plus stamp duty).
normalised: Pro-tip: Get it registered! It avoids legal hassles and is usually a small fee (around rupees one thousand one hundred plus stamp duty).

unnormalised: And if you're near IIT Bombay, check with their student housing council - they sometimes offer legal awareness sessions. Don't be a 'Munna Bhai' and go in blind!
normalised: And if you are near I I T Bombay, check with their student housing council - they sometimes offer legal awareness sessions. Do not be a 'Munna Bhai' and go in blind!
